title: Test skipper Paine rested for Shield clash
text:
Australia Test captain Tim Paine has been rested for Tasmania's Sheffield Shield match against Victoria starting on Thursday.

Earlier this month, the veteran wicketkeeper/batsman ended a 13-year drought in scoring his second first-class century in the Tigers' opening match of the season against Western Australia earlier this month.

The 34-year-old Paine is not the only change to the Tasmanian line-up that was beaten by NSW last week.

Ben McDermott (national duty), Jordan Silk (injured), Lawrence Neil-Smith (illness), Jarrod Freeman (omitted) and Clive Rose (omitted) are also out.

The big inclusions are the returns of former Test players George Bailey and Jackson Bird while Jake Doran, Gabe Bell and Charlie Wakim also come back into the 12-man squad.

Matthew Wade will again captain Tasmania for the Bellerive Oval meeting, with both teams aiming for a first win of the campaign.
